  Description du poste: 
 
   Énergie atomique du Canada limitée (EACL) reconnaît avec gratitude que nous opérons sur des territoires qui, depuis des temps immémoriaux, sont les terres traditionnelles des peuples autochtones du Canada.
 
 
   
 
 EACL vous convient?
 
   En tant que société d’État canadienne, EACL a pour mandat de permettre le développement de la science et la technologie nucléaires, et de gérer les responsabilités du gouvernement du Canada en matière de déchets radioactifs. Depuis 2015, EACL exécute son mandat par l’intermediaire d’un modèle d’organisme gouvernemental exploité par un entrepreneur (OGEE), selon lequel une organisation du secteur privé, les Laboratoires nucléaires canadiens (LNC), est responsable de la gestion et de l’exploitation des sites d’EACL, en vertu d’accords à long terme. Les objectifs d’EACL dans le cadre du modèle OGEE comprennent l’accélération de la gestion de l’assainissement de l’environnement, la gestion du Plan de travail fédéral en matiere de science et de technologie nucléaires à l’appui des priorités et des besoins du gouvernement, et la construction d’un laboratoire nucléaire de calibre mondial qui répond aux priorités du gouvernement et qui augmente les revenus commerciaux, tout en réduisant ou en limitant les coûts et les risques pour le Canada.
 
  Ce que vous ferez :
 
   Sous la responsabilité d’un(e) vice-président(e), l’adjoint(e) de direction est chargé(e) d’assurer l’efficacité de l’organisation, le service à la clientèle, la gestion des relations et la realisation d’activités administratives clés pour un maximum de quatre dirigeants(es). Dans ce rôle, vous agissez avec professionnalisme et tact tout en gérant une vaste gamme de tâches administratives de niveau exécutif qui sont de nature sensible et confidentielle. Vous êtes organisé(e) et vous aidez à résoudre les difficultés administratives inhérentes au soutien d’une équipe diversifiée dans un environnement en constante évolution.
 
 
 
   Vous prenez des initiatives et jonglez avec des demandes concurrentes tout en recherchant des possibilités d’améliorer les processus et pratiques administratives. Vous vous appuyez sur vos connaissances pratiques et spécialisées en matière des processus et procédures de soutien aux entreprises pour répondre aux besoins des intervenants internes et externes avec tact et discrétion. Vous pensez à l’avenir, vous anticipez les besoins et vous acquittez vos responsabilités avec un minimum de directives.
 
  Ce que vous apportez :
 
   Diplôme en administration des affaires.
   Le bilinguisme (français et anglais) est considéré comme un atout.
   5 ans d’expérience en soutien aux cadres supérieurs.
   Une compréhension solide des normes documentaires de l’entreprise et une attention rigoureuse aux détails et à la précision dans la tenue des dossiers, des ordres du jour, des procès-verbaux, des fichiers électroniques, etc.
   Solides compétences en matière de planification et approche très organisée du travail.
   Doit avoir l’esprit d’équipe et savoir communiquer efficacement afin de promouvoir un environnement de travail positif.
   Aptitude avérée à aborder le travail avec tact, diplomatie et un haut niveau de confiance et de discrétion dans le traitement d’informations sensibles et confidentielles.
   Capacité et volonté de travailler avec un minimum de supervision dans un environnement d’équipe qui requiert de l’initiative.
   Capacité à s’auto-motiver et à travailler efficacement avec tous les niveaux d’employés, tant en personne qu’au téléphone; capacité d’interagir efficacement avec d’autres groupes, en particulier ceux des autres sites d’EACL, et d’autres groupes externes à EACL.
   Motivé pour trouver des gains d’efficacité et améliorer continuellement les processus et les procédures.
   Capacité àrésoudre des problèmes et à faire preuve d’un esprit critique efficace.
   Connaissances avancées des produits Microsoft Office (Word, Outlook, PowerPoint et Excel) et aptitude à apprendre de nouveaux logiciels, technologies et systèmes.
   Créativité, innovation, flexibilité et adaptabilité pour gérer les multiples priorités et calendriers d’EACL.
 
  Ce que nous offrons :
 
   Prestations médicales et dentaires complètes par l’entremise du gouvernement du Canada.
   Participation au Régime de pension de retraite de la fonction publique (un régime de retraite à prestations déterminées indexées) pour vous aider à planifier votre retraite.
   Des vacances, des conges personnels et des jours flottants à utiliser pour favoriser votre bien-être physique et mental.
   Un programme confidentiel d’aide aux employés pour vous aider à relever les défis auxquels vous ou vos personnes à votre charge pouvez être confrontés.
   Accès instantané, 24 heures sur 24 et 7 jours sur 7, à des médecins en ligne par l’intermédiaire de Maple, qui vous couvre, et vos personnes à votre charge en cas de besoin médical.
   Ressources sur la pleine conscience et la méditation par l’intermédiaire de Headspace pour soutenir votre santé mentale.
   Un modèle de travail hybride flexible qui vous permet de trouver un équilibre entre le travail à domicile et l’entretien des relations en personnes.
 
  Ce à quoi vous pouvez vous attendre :
 
   Cette annonce demeurera affichée, mais nous commencerons à examiner les candidatures le 23 octobre 2023.
   Cette annonce concerne deux postes temporaires à temps plein d’une durée d’un an. Le premier poste sera base au bureau d’EACL à Chalk River, en Ontario, et le second au bureau d’EACL à Ottawa, en Ontario.
   Ce concours comporte deux séries d’entrevues.
   Le candidat sélectionné doit satisfaire aux exigences du gouvernement du Canada en matière d’habilitation de sécurité.
   Bien que nous apprécions sincèrement toutes les demandes d’emploi, seuls les candidats sélectionnés pour une entrevue seront contactés.
   La préférence peut être donnée aux personnes bilingues.
 
 
   
 
 
  A EACL, nous nous engageons à créer un milieu de travail authentique; la promotion de la diversité, de l’équité, de l’inclusion et de l’accessibilité nous tient à cœur. Nous accueillons les candidatures des femmes, des minorités visibles, des autochtones, des personnes handicapées et des personnes de toute identité, et expression de genre et de toute orientation sexuelle. La préférence peut être donnée aux membres d’un groupe désigné afin de remédier à une sous-représentation identifiée. Nous encourageons les candidats à s’identifier.
 
 
   
 
 
  EACL fournit un soutien et des aménagements raisonnable dans les processus de recrutement aux candidats handicapes, y compris des aménagements qui prennent en compte les besoins d’accessibilite d’un candidat. Si vous souffrez d’un handicap qui nécessite une mesure d’adaptation pendant notre processus de recrutement, faites-nous savoir comment nous pouvons vous aider en envoyant un courriel à 
  hr@aecl.ca.
 
  À propos d’EACL :
 
 
  
   
     www.aecl.ca
   
  
  
  
   
     @AECL
   
  
  
  
   
     @AECL_EACL
   
  
  
  
   
    
      @atomicenergycanada

Company Description
  Do you want to be part of our successful Real Estate team supporting top clients for Turner & Townsend in Ottawa? We are hiring an ambitious and forward thinking Administrative Assistant to support our team in the Ottawa office.
  At Turner & Townsend we’re passionate about making the difference. That means delivering better outcomes for our clients, helping our people to realize their potential, and doing our part to create a prosperous society.
  Our team is dynamic, innovative and client-focused. Our clients value our proactive approach, depth of expertise, integrity and the quality we deliver. As a result our people get to work on some of the most exciting projects in the world
  Who are you?
  You are an Administrative Assistant with a minimum of 5 years of experience in an administrative support role. You are comfortable liaising with senior internal and external stakeholders.
 
 

 Job Description
  You will be key in supporting the operations and administration for the office, supporting the Cost Centre Lead in Ottawa:
 
   Support Turner & Townsend’s ‘Bid to Win’ process for all pursuits within the Canadian business, ensuring engaged participation from directors and SMEs to achieve a high-quality deliverable.
   Support with meetings (book boardroom rooms, prepare and distribute documents, action items) for various internal meetings.
   Take minutes/action items in meetings
   Follow up with Management/Team on developing agendas and distributing/preparing documents.
   Raising invoices and purchase orders
   Supporting with document control – Quality Assurance & Quality Control
   Prepare record of discussions by taking notes and picking out appropriate action items.
   Assisting in the preparation of reports
   Assist the Cost Centre Lead managing aspects of their calendar, booking flights and accommodation, etc.
 
 
 

 Qualifications
  
 
   Excellent written and verbal communication skills
   Experience in business administrative settings and meetings with Senior Management present.
   Document Controls experience highly desirable
   Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail.
   Proactive behaviour, showing initiative and being action oriented.
   Monitors progress and quality of work, making adjustments as needed to meet and exceed expectations.
   Well-mannered and professional and team player in a high profile environment.
   Able to utilise all Office 365 tools at the intermediate level.
   Microsoft Visio would be advantageous
 
  Essential Experience/Qualifications
 
   Minimum 5 years of experience in an administrative support role
   Post-secondary education certificate, diploma or degree preferred
   Experience in consultancy strongly preferred
   Bilingual with French & English is an asset
   Ability to be granted a Level 1 security clearance
 
  Additional Information
  Our inspired people share our vision and mission. We provide a great place to work, where each person has the opportunity and voice to affect change.
  We want our people to succeed both in work and life. To support this we promote a healthy, productive and flexible working environment that respects work-life balance.
  Turner & Townsend is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees and actively encourage applications from all sectors of the community.
  Please find out more about us at www.turnerandtownsend.com/
  #LI-Hybrid
 
  Join our social media conversations for more information about Turner & Townsend and our exciting future projects:
  Twitter
  Instagram
  LinkedIn 
  It is strictly against Turner & Townsend policy for candidates to pay any fee in relation to our recruitment process. No recruitment agency working with Turner & Townsend will ask candidates to pay a fee at any time.
  Any unsolicited resumes/CVs submitted through our website or to Turner & Townsend personal e-mail accounts, are considered property of Turner & Townsend and are not subject to payment of agency fees. In order to be an authorised Recruitment Agency/Search Firm for Turner & Townsend, there must be a formal written agreement in place and the agency must be invited, by the Recruitment Team, to submit candidates for review.

  About The Royal
  
 As one of Canada’s foremost mental health care and academic health science centres, The Royal has a clear purpose: to get more people living with mental illness into recovery faster. This is at the core of everything we do and it is driven by the passion, focus and dedication of our employees. Every day, the work that we do transforms the lives of people with mental illness through specialized mental healthcare, advocacy, research and education. 
 
 This position provides professional administrative support and office management to the Associate Chief, the Vice President Patient Care Services & Chief Nursing Executive, and the Vice President Patient Care Services & Community Mental Health; to ensure efficient and effective administration of the department/program.
  Duties:
  Accountability #1: Administrative support/Office management
 
   Responsible for organization & scheduling of meetings, including collection of agenda items, follow up on action items, preparation and distribution of agenda packages, recording, production and distribution of minutes
   Manages calendars and assists with time management
   Drafts and types correspondence, receives/sends mail, including email
   Responds to queries from the general public, hospital departments, external organizations 
  Screens and actions incoming mail, emails and telephone calls using own judgment and knowledge
   Makes travel arrangements & completes expense reports as required
   Ensures all deadlines are met, including project tracking, information gathering, report production, etc.
   Schedules staff meetings
   Provides office and automated systems orientation and training for new staff members
   Prepares invoices/requisitions as required for ordering office supplies, materials, repairs, etc.
   Prepares Personnel Action Forms of reporting staff and other documents, as required
   Provides daily schedule including preparation of background information for the days’ meetings
   Maintains bring forward system and organizes/maintains an effective filing system
   Maintains OREO pages for department/program
   Coordinates site visits
   Arranges interviews and prepares information for potential and new physicians, composes offer letters and gathers appropriate information for credentialing
   Ensures sessionals/stipends are paid accurately
   Requests cheques for physicians not paid through Medco Services
   Prepares & drafts PowerPoint presentations and other presentations as required
   Schedules on-call services physicians
   Liaises with senior management teams, directors and their administrative assistants
   Liaises with pharmaceutical representatives to plan and schedule continuing mental health education sessions; plan, advertise, evaluate feedback, follow up for conferences
 
  Accountability #2: Budgeting responsibilities
 
   Assists with annual budget preparation
   Assists with budget planning; monitors and tracks budget expenses – operating and salary
   Audits payroll, sick leave, vacation and labour distribution reports and reports variances
 
  Accountability #3: Data Management
 
   Organizes/maintains major legal, financial and administrative documents
   Assists in gathering, compilation and dissemination of data and statistics
   Maintains the corporate files of the program/department
   Maintains accurate leave records for staff
   Ensures confidentiality of sensitive information – patient correspondence, public enquires, patient/family complaints
   Processes bi-weekly pay cards and maintains appropriate supporting documentation
   Maintains a copy of all policies and procedures and updates as new polices/procedures become available
   Facilitates completion of annual performance appraisals of reporting staff
   Processes and maintains billing for the Associate Chief and Physicians
 
  Accountability #4: Other Duties
 
   Assists with projects as needed
   Works in a manner that is in compliance with staff and patient/client safety practices, policies and procedures of The Royal.
   Ensures a work environment that is conducive to The Royal’s Harassment-Free Workplace and Occupational Health and Safety policies.
   Undertakes special assignments/projects and other duties as assigned.
 
  Qualifications:
 
   Post-secondary level education, preferably a two (2) year community college diploma in Office Administration or equivalent experience
   Minimum of five years recent, related secretarial/administrative experience supporting senior level management
   Typing speed – minimum of 60 words per minute with high accuracy.
   Demonstrated experience in windows-based applications including a high level of competency with Outlook, Microsoft Office Suite (Word, PowerPoint, and Excel). 
  Planning, prioritization and organization skills to ensure that tasks are completed; work well under pressure
   Power B1 system knowledge would be an asset
   Demonstrate interpersonal skills and proficiency in business vocabulary
   Time management skills to plan, manage and coordinate activities
   Attention to detail and decision-making skills to respond to high-pressure situations
   Demonstrate ability to handle confidential/sensitive information
   Prepare clear, concise and accurate documentation
   Establish and maintain effective working relationships
   Ability to work independently in the completion of assigned tasks

description:

    ABOUT THE ROLE:
  
   
   
  
    The Client Engagement Lead is a member of team at Accreditation Canada. We are seeking a dynamic leader that has experience in Canadian Health Systems and particularly knowledge of the British Columbia and Manitoba Health Systems. The client lead will primarily be accountable to lead all health systems accreditation activities for Manitoba and British Columbia, more specifically being responsible for leading the Accreditation Canada Accreditation Program, including the updated assessment programs, digital platforms, and standards, which further embed our philosophy of People Powered Health™ and continuous quality improvement. The Client Engagement Lead will manage and provide support to client organizations while consulting and advising for improving the quality of care for all. The person in this role can take joy in working alongside other dedicated and compassionate Client Engagement Leads, the full accreditation team and many other supports across Accreditation Canada and Health Standards Organization.
  
   
   
  
    The person in this role may be required at times to work evenings and weekends when managing accreditation survey activities. When this occurs, you will have the capacity to compensate these extra hours as flex time and take them off later. We value employee balance work/life.
  
   
  
    
  
  
   Main Responsibilities:
  
   
   
   
   Building relationships with client organizations and supporting them where they are at in their accreditation cycles in the interest of increasing their capacity for continuous quality improvement. 
   Support and lead the Accreditation team to become proficient in the planning and implementation of the survey process that is focused on quality while working efficiently to meet targets. 
   Plan, organize, implement, and evaluate the Accreditation Program and represent the program both internally and with external partners and funders. 
   Work effectively with partners and stakeholders of diverse backgrounds to co-create the next era of quality improvement and patient safety initiatives. 
   Holds people accountable for results they can control while providing guidance, conflict resolution and a proactive approach in identifying success for the team. 
   
  
  
   Must Have Qualifications:
  
   
   
   
   University degree at a master’s level is preferred. An equivalent combination of work experience and education will be considered. 
   Three to five years of progressive experience leading teams with health care and quality improvement experience. Demonstrated problem-solving skills to identify root causes and develop effective solutions. 
   Strong verbal and written communication skills. 
   Knowledge of quality improvement principles.
  
   
   
  
    Desired Qualifications and Attributes:
  
   
   
   Knowledge of HSO standards 
   Experience in Accreditation Canada process 
   Proficiency in a comprehensive range of Microsoft applications including Teams, Word, and Excel 
   A leadership style orientation to empathetic, team oriented working relationships 
   Experience in change management and systems transformation. 
   Have project management qualification(s) and/or experience. 
   Have quality assurance and improvement qualification(s). 
   Have experience in client services.
  
   
   You will stand out if: 
   
   You are an Accreditation Canada surveyor or are in the process of becoming one. 
   Completely bilingual in Canada’s official languages. 
   
  
   WHAT YOU CAN EXPECT:
  
   
   
  
    In Your First 30-90 Days: 
  
  
   Complete our orientation program with other new employees to learn about HSO, our values of trust, inclusion, collaboration, innovation and learning, and our mission of quality improvement in healthcare and social services. 
   Enroll in the Accreditation Canada surveyor training modules as part of the orientation and familiarize yourself with the HSO standards. 
   Review and learn departmental policies, procedures, IT platforms and workflows. 
   Set your performance and learning objectives for the year in collaboration with your people manager.

   Take on assigned initiatives or projects for your role. 
   
  
  
   What We Can Offer to You
   :

   Hybrid work model for candidates in Ottawa/Montreal/Toronto area 
   A remote model for candidates outside Ottawa/Montreal/Toronto area. 
  
  
   Competitive compensation and benefits, including a defined benefit pension plan. 
   Time-off programs, including office shutdown during last week of December. 
   Professional development support. 
   A culture that measures and values psychological safety, inclusion, and engagement.
  
   
   
  
    WHO WE ARE AND WHAT WE DO:
   
   Health Standards Organization (HSO) and our affiliates Accreditation Canada (AC) and the Institute for Quality Management in Healthcare (IQMH) are global, not-for-profit organizations. Together, we develop standards and deliver assessment programs and quality improvement solutions that have been adopted in over 12,000 locations across five continents. Our people-centered programs and services have been setting the bar for quality across the health ecosystem for 65 years.

We encourage qualified applications from all genders, including visible minorities, Indigenous Peoples, and persons with disabilities. We thank all applicants for their interest; only those selected for an interview will be contacted. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. To request accommodation, please email HR at HumanResources@healthstandards.org. For any queries related to recruitment please email at recruitment@healthstandards.org.

SurveyMonkey is a global leader in online surveys and forms that empowers people with the insights they need to make decisions with speed and confidence. Our fast, intuitive feedback management platform connects millions of users worldwide with real-time AI-powered insights that drive meaningful decisions. We provide answers to more than 20 million questions every day so that people and organizations can attract new audiences, delight customers, create advocates, and extend their competitive advantage in the marketplace. Our vision is to raise the bar for human experiences by amplifying individual voices. Learn more at surveymonkey.com.
 
  What we're looking for 
  SurveyMonkey has built a sustainable growth engine. We have over 600M+ website visitors, 17M+ Free users, ~900K paying users, and a footprint in 345K+ organizations, from your local restaurants to 95% of the Fortune 500. We amplify the voices of a billion people across the globe every year. On the backs of an amazing product suite and a multi-channel go-to-market strategy, we have also built an amazing business with sustained growth, industry-leading gross-margins, high cash flow generation, and world-class retention. And we are only looking to accelerate our delivery of excellence. 
  As SurveyMonkey continues its journey to $1B+ in revenue, we are seeking a data-driven Product Manager with a strong background in Conversion Rate Optimization (CRO) to lead our efforts in optimizing the conversion funnel across the SurveyMonkey website. The ideal candidate will possess a proven track record of conceptualizing, executing, and analyzing web experiments that drive measurable improvements in user engagement and conversion rates. Reporting to the Manager of Web Experience & Growth, the Product Manager, CRO, will play a critical role in enhancing the overall user experience and driving business growth on the website globally. 
  What you'll be working on 
  
  Develop and execute comprehensive global web growth strategies to optimize user journeys and maximize conversion rates across SurveyMonkey's digital channels. 
  Conduct data-driven analysis of user behavior to identify areas for CRO improvement and potential growth opportunities. 
  Lead the optimization of landing pages, forms, calls-to-action, and user flows to enhance user engagement and conversion rates. 
  Define clear and measurable experiment objectives, generate hypotheses, and design A/B and multivariate tests to validate hypotheses. 
  Analyze experiment results and present findings to key stakeholders, drawing actionable insights and recommendations to inform future optimization efforts. 
  Monitor and report on key performance metrics, tracking progress toward CRO goals and objectives. 
  Stay abreast of industry best practices and emerging trends in CRO, user experience, and web optimization, incorporating new insights into ongoing strategies. 
  Monitor competitor websites and conduct industry benchmarking to identify opportunities for differentiation and innovation. 
  
 We'd love to hear from people with 
  
  Bachelor's degree in a related field 
  At least 2+ years in conversion rate optimization, web experimentation, and A/B testing, ideally within an e-commerce, SaaS, or technology-driven company. 
  Strong analytical skills, with the ability to translate data into actionable insights and recommendations. 
  Proficiency in using web analytics and experimentation tools (such as Google Analytics, Optimizely, etc.) to design and analyze experiments. 
  Results-driven mindset with a passion for optimizing user experiences and achieving tangible business outcomes. 
  Strong problem-solving skills and a proactive attitude towards identifying and addressing challenges. 
  SaaS experience is highly preferred, particularly with self-serve, freemium business models.

  About the Telfer School of Management
  The Telfer School of Management at the University of Ottawa is located in the heart of Ottawa and is the proud academic home of some 4,300 students,200 faculty members, over 100 staff members, and over 30,000 alumni.
  At Telfer, everything we do from teaching to research, to policy advice is firmly aligned with helping Canada reach its potential. We believe that better business practice means a better Canada and that a better Canada means a better world.
 
 
   Position Purpose:
 
 
   The incumbent oversees the day-to-day technical and administrative operations of the Triple-I Lab, a behavioural lab space equipped with observational research technology used primarily for social science research (e.g., management, communications, education, psychology). The lab is a collaborative initiative between the Telfer School of Management and the Faculty of Arts at the University of Ottawa. It will be used by faculty members, post-doctoral researchers, and graduate students, and research assistants across the University of Ottawa to conduct experiments on social behaviour and interactions.
 
 
 
   In this role, your responsibilities will include:
 
 
   Manages and oversees the daily operations of the laboratory including opening lab in the morning before study sessions, ensuring lab is secure and locked at end of day, providing guidance and assistance to authorized users regarding technical issues, helping users begin data collection, and supervising general laboratory usage.
   Conducts periodic assessments of laboratory technology to ensure proper calibration and timed integration across various data collection tools. Troubleshoots potential problems with technology and communicates with key points of contact in IT and suppliers’ helpline to identify solutions to problems with technology. Informs Principal Investigators of potential issues with equipment.
   Ensures users have required permissions and authority to use the lab prior to beginning data collection, including ensuring users have paid user fees, received formal training with equipment, and provided evidence of relevant Research Ethics Board approval.
   Creates guiding documents for ethics approval and assists users on as needed basis with ethics applications.
   Facilitates application process required to establish the lab as a core facility, including writing application materials and mandatory annual reports.
   Develops and maintains computerized tracking system and record management systems to store and process data, such as personnel activities and schedules, user login credentials, users’ keys and key cards to access the lab and equipment used off site.
 
 
 
   What you will bring
 
 
   Master’s degree with thesis or higher in a discipline associated with social sciences.
   At least two years of relevant experience conducting research in social sciences, or an equivalent combination of experience and educational qualifications.
   Knowledge of, and experience working in a behavioural lab setting, including the use of observational software, interaction analysis software, and emotion recognition software.
   Expertise in designing and setting up observational studies, including coordinating multiple simultaneous studies.
   Experience creating training documents and planning and delivering training sessions.
   Demonstration of interpersonal, collaboration, and problem-solving skills.
   Demonstration of technical, scientific, and communications skills (written/oral).
   Demonstration of organizational and prioritization skills.
   The incumbent must be flexible to work some evenings and weekends to support research activities at several points throughout the year.
   Advanced written and verbal skills in English or French. Bilingualism, spoken and written, is strongly preferred.
 
 
 
   Key Competencies at uOttawa:
   Here are the required competencies for all or our employees at uOttawa:
   
   Planning: Organize in time a series of actions or events in order to realize an objective or a project. Plan and organize own work and priorities in regular daily activities.
   Initiative: Demonstrate creativity and initiative to suggest improvements and encourage positive results. Is proactive and self-starting. Show availability and willingness to go above and beyond whenever it is possible.
   Client Service Orientation: Help or serve others to meet their needs. This implies anticipating and identifying the needs of internal and external clients and finding solutions on how to meet them.
   Teamwork and Cooperation: Cooperate and work well with other members of the team to reach common goal(s). Accept and give constructive feedback. Able to adjust own behaviour to reach the goals of the team.
   
   The University of Ottawa embraces diversity and inclusion in the workplace. We are passionate about our people and committed to employment equity. We foster a culture of respect, teamwork and inclusion, where collaboration, innovation, and creativity fuel our quest for research and teaching excellence. While all qualified persons are invited to apply, we welcome applications from qualified Indigenous persons, racialized persons, persons with disabilities, women and LGBTQIA2S+ persons. The University is committed to creating and maintaining an accessible, barrier-free work environment. The University is also committed to working with applicants with disabilities requesting accommodation during the recruitment, assessment and selection processes. Applicants with disabilities may contact hrtalentmanagement@uottawa.ca to communicate the accommodation need. All qualified candidates are encouraged to apply; however, Canadians and permanent residents will be given priority.

At Ontario Health, we are committed to developing a strong organizational culture that connects and inspires all team members across the province. Our vision is that together, we will be a leader in health and wellness for all. Our mission is to connect the health system to drive improved and equitable health outcomes, experiences and value. How we work together is reflected through our five values: integrity, inspiration, tenacity, humility and care.
 
 
 
   Want to make a difference in your career? Consider this opportunity!
 
 
 
  
    Reporting to: Manager, Provincial Resource Centre - Tissue
  
  
    Classification: Tissue Coordinator
  
  
    Worksite: Toronto (currently hybrid; subject to change)
  
  
    Schedule: Combination of weekday and weekend 12 hour shifts
  
  
  
    Trillium Gift of Life Network (TGLN), part of Ontario Health, is responsible for the coordination of organ and tissue donation and transplantation in Ontario. Our mandate includes increasing public awareness of the importance of organ and tissue donation, education of health care professionals, and ensuring a safe and effective donation and transplant system in Ontario. Working collaboratively with our stakeholders and fostering organizational and individual growth, we value honesty, trust, respect and compassion.
  
  
  
    We are currently seeking a highly motivated full-time Tissue Coordinator (TC) for a 12 month contract. The incumbent shall provide professional services related to tissue donation in a manner consistent with the mission and values of TGLN. The Tissue Coordinator completes processes for donor screening, approaches families for consent to donate, secures acceptance of tissues by various tissue banks, coordinates recovery activities, and conducts family follow up post-donation for consented non-recovered tissues.
  
  
  
    Here is what you will be doing:
  
  
   
    
      Responds to calls from referring hospitals received in the Provincial Resource Centre, conducts a preliminary assessment of the patient’s history and identifies all relevant donation options
    
   
    
      Provides consultation services as an expert in matters relating to tissue donation
    
   
    
      Assesses expert consultation regarding tissue suitability or other medical issues as appropriate
    
   
    
      Provides complete information to the tissue bank(s) concerning donor and tissue suitability for placement of tissues. The information is provided in a manner that complies with existing privacy legislation and TGLN confidentiality policies
    
   
    
      Timely completion of the medical-social questionnaire, usually at time of donation, occasionally at a pre-arranged date and time to minimize missed opportunities
    
   
    
      Liaises continuously with on-site personnel (i.e. Organ and Tissue Donation Specialist, health-care professionals and recovery staff) at referring hospital to complete risk assessment, screening, testing and evaluation of individual tissue suitability after consent
    
   
    
      Works with the coroner’s office to facilitate tissue donation and escalates cases to Regional Supervising Coroner on a case by case basis
    
   
    
      Obtains temporary surgical privileges for tissue recovery personnel, when necessary, in accordance with the policies of the referring hospital, ensuring compliance with the credentialing process is in place at the time
    
   
    
      Coordinates timing and confirmation of recovery facility (OR) availability and arrival of tissue recovery teams
    
   
    
      Conveys all relevant information regarding the donor to the appropriate tissue recovery personnel and relevant Tissue Bank
    
   
    
      Ensures relevant hospital department(s) are contacted following tissue recovery for timely transport of body to funeral home
    
   
    
      Maintains a professional and courteous demeanour with stakeholders at all times
    
   
    
      Performs other duties as required

      Ability to maintain and protect patient confidentiality at all times, demonstrating use of discretion and sound judgment
    
   
    
      Accuracy and close attention to detail
